item.description:

What coon said. Man killer, If you don’t want his cc, just say your trying for something different. Squirrle, if he doesn’t want you cc, don’t bother offering.

Also, I’m glad coon agrees with me. You need an elbow or a way to turn the arm
[/quote]

Having an elbow just makes for easier animating in my opinion. Without one, you must work around, and try to figure out the best-suited area for the change in weight and such to best fit for an elbow.[/quote]
Well that and he has no physical way of “slashing” at the moment.

item.title: Minion for my Necromancer
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

Children, this is why is why i stopped coming to the model section. Childish flaming and such over nothing. Human bodies are not easy to model, let alone get the anatomy of. Sure, you are a living human, but you don’t understand the actual complexity there is, of you just being able to walk. Even a part inside of your ear plays a role in your balance. Without that, you wouldn’t know up from down.

@MODEL - Its not bad for a RSPS NPC. You still wouldn’t see all of that detail, but it is nice. I would suggest making a elbow though, or at least cutting the arm at one point, to make something like an elbow for animating.

Read full topic

item.title: Minion for my Necromancer
item.dc:creator: @Orngequirrel Orngequirrel
item.description:
@Orngequirrel wrote:

[quote=“man_killerx, post:12, topic:339040”][quote author=Orngequirrel link=topic=435425.msg3198562#msg3198562 date=1273058389]
Monster or not, a bone structure like that would kill you right away. Without a breastbone your ribs won’t have anything to support them and they will get crushed extremely easy. A kneecap being a ring isn’t going to support a hinge joint movement, as the leg won’t stop in the ring. Don’t you think before you try to get all defensive? The skeleton anatomy is horrible monster or not.
[/quote]
Will you be less retarded before you comment? Those “Rings” Are fucking guards, Again IT IS NOT A FUCKING HUMAN so the fucking RIBS do not matter they could be harder then steel for all you know.[/quote]
OH MY GOD. I’m sooooo sorry I offered criticism. I’m soooooo sorry I offered it to make you better at modeling, but I guess I’m not allowed to make people better. I guess you have to be braindead and not take it? I’m sooooo sorry that you can’t take criticism, which is fucking necessary if you want to be better. And I’m sooooo sorry that you don’t understand that since it looks almost identical to a human, it should have similar anatomy. You don’t see monkeys or any creature with awful bone structure like that. Or maybe you don’t fucking DESERVE the criticism because you’re too god damn immature to take it?

item.title: Minion for my Necromancer
item.dc:creator: @MistaBigBoss MistaBigBoss
item.description:
@MistaBigBoss wrote:

[quote=“Phaze One, post:13, topic:339040”][quote author=Orngequirrel link=topic=435425.msg3197822#msg3197822 date=1272972733]
You need to work on your skeleton anatomy more.

There’s no pelvis, just a curved block, there should be two bones in the forearm (you have one) and lower leg (you…have 3…what), and there is only one bone in the femur, there is no breastbone, the ribs just abruptly end, the ribcage goes on too far for the lumbar vertebrae to start, and the kneecap is a ring, and uh, he seems to have monkey hands for feet.
[/quote]

obvious fucking smart ass is fucking obvious?[/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: Minion for my Necromancer
item.dc:creator: @man_killerx man_killerx
item.description:
@man_killerx wrote:

Orngequirrel:

Monster or not, a bone structure like that would kill you right away. Without a breastbone your ribs won’t have anything to support them and they will get crushed extremely easy. A kneecap being a ring isn’t going to support a hinge joint movement, as the leg won’t stop in the ring. Don’t you think before you try to get all defensive? The skeleton anatomy is horrible monster or not.

Will you be less retarded before you comment? Those “Rings” Are fucking guards, Again IT IS NOT A FUCKING HUMAN so the fucking RIBS do not matter they could be harder then steel for all you know.

You need to work on your skeleton anatomy more.

There’s no pelvis, just a curved block, there should be two bones in the forearm (you have one) and lower leg (you…have 3…what), and there is only one bone in the femur, there is no breastbone, the ribs just abruptly end, the ribcage goes on too far for the lumbar vertebrae to start, and the kneecap is a ring, and uh, he seems to have monkey hands for feet.

Retard it is a monster, Not a human. Dur dur.[/quote]
Monster or not, a bone structure like that would kill you right away. Without a breastbone your ribs won’t have anything to support them and they will get crushed extremely easy. A kneecap being a ring isn’t going to support a hinge joint movement, as the leg won’t stop in the ring. Don’t you think before you try to get all defensive? The skeleton anatomy is horrible monster or not.
